thread.title: The Emmys: Funniest highlights and biggest controversies from seven decades | DailyTelegraph
thread.title_full: The Emmys: Funniest highlights and biggest controversies from seven decades | DailyTelegraph

author: Andrew Fenton
title: The Emmys: Funniest highlights and biggest controversies from seven decades | DailyTelegraph
text:
THE Emmy Award may not have the same prestige as the Oscars, or the shock value of the Golden Globes, but US television’s night of night’s always produces some memorable moments. There seems little doubt we’ll see a few more when Andy Samberg hosts the 67th Primetime Emmy Awards on Monday.
Here are some of the highlights — and lowlights — throughout the years.
Worst Emmy Awards ever ... Tom Bergeron and William Shatner clown with co-host Heidi Klum at the 2008 awards, the lowest rated in history and widely regarded as terrible. Picture: Supplied
Pioneer ... The first ever Emmy winner, Ventriloquist Shirley Dinsdale, with puppet Judy Splinters. Picture: Supplied
In different times ... Bill Cosby poses with his Emmy for his role in I Spy in 1966. Picture: Supplied
Imposter ... Barry Bremen had a tux, but no right to accept an Emmy. Picture: YouTube
Hair change ... Brad Pitt’s haircut wins on points against Jennifer Aniston’s faux dreadlocks at the 51st annual Emmy Awards in 1999.
Winner ... Alec Baldwin holds the Best Actor in a Comedy award at the 2009 Emmy Awards. Picture: AFP/ Robyn Beck
1 of n
